alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Panola; Tallahatchie; Yalobusha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:26PM CDT until March 25 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT SATURDAY FOR WESTERN LAFAYETTE, SOUTHEASTERN PANOLA, NORTHEASTERN TALLAHATCHIE AND NORTHWESTERN YALOBUSHA COUNTIES... At 1026 PM CDT, emergency management reported flash flooding due to thunderstorms producing heavy rain. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oxford, Batesville, Water Valley, George Payne State Park, Holly Springs National Forest, Pope, Burgess, Springdale, Enid, Oakland, Courtland, Abbeville, Taylor, Shuford, Eureka Springs, College Hill and College Hill Station. Flooding was observed along O`Hara Road in the Twelve Oaks Subdivision just northwest of Oxford. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
